page.title: 12AGRICULTURE & CHEMICALS
page.content: Farmers are increasingly using {chemicals}to assist them in their work to produce more corn. As soon as harvest is over the land is prepared for the next crop, this includes {spraying weed killer.}At various times in it's growth the crop may be attacked by{insects}so it is regularly sprayed. Sometimes there is a risk of {mildew}or{fungus}so the crop is sprayed again. The fields are crossed with{'tram lines'}- tracks through the corn where the tractors regularly go. Chemical{fertilizers}are used to increase the yield and there is even a spray to regulate stalk growth. If vehicles would spoil the crop then {aeroplanes}are used to spray from the air. All these chemicals produce greater yields but people are worried about the effects on{public health. {Nitrate}levels in water are too high.
